properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 3 at 3:56AM PST until January 4 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY IN THE CASCADE
MOUNTAINS...

.Several rounds of moderate to heavy snow will impact the Cascade
Crest this weekend into next week. Accumulations of 8 to 12 inches
are expected at Stevens Pass tonight through Saturday afternoon.
More heavy snow will be possible Sunday and Sunday night and again
Tuesday.

* WHAT...Snow expected for The Cascade Crest including Highway 2
between Coles Corner and Stevens Pass. Total snow accumulations
of 8 to 12 inches.

* WHERE...Elevations above 3500 feet around Lake Wenatchee,
Stehekin, Holden Village, and Mazama.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Treacherous driving conditions on Highway 2 from Coles
Corner to Stevens Pass.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A series of weather systems will bring
periods of moderate to heavy snow to the Cascades this weekend
into next week. If you have plans to travel over the Cascade
Passes the next several days, monitor road reports closely.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY FOR THE CASCADE CREST INCLUDING HIGHWAY 2 BETWEEN COLES CORNER AND STEVENS PASS
